title: ICE: unwrap none error in compiler\rustc_mir\src\monomorphize\collector.rs

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body: ### Code ```Rust #![crate_type="lib"] use std::{collections::HashMap, hash::Hash}; struct C; trait Ctx { type BindGroupId; } impl Ctx for C { type BindGroupId = u32; } pub struct BindGroup { _id: ::BindGroupId, } #[derive(Copy, Clone)] pub struct BindGroupRef<'a>(&'a BindGroup); impl<'a> PartialEq for BindGroupRef<'a> { fn eq(&self, other: &Self) -> bool { &*self.0 as *const BindGroup == &*other.0 as *const BindGroup } } impl<'a> Eq for BindGroupRef<'a> {} impl<'a> Hash for BindGroupRef<'a> { fn hash(&self, state: &mut H) { (&*self.0 as *const BindGroup).hash(state); } } pub struct Context<'a> { map: HashMap, u32>, } impl<'a> Context<'a> { pub fn insert(&mut self, bind_group: &'a BindGroup) { self.map.insert(BindGroupRef(bind_group), 1); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.52.1 (9bc8c42bb 2021-05-09) binary: rustc commit-hash: 9bc8c42bb2f19e745a63f3445f1ac248fb015e53 commit-date: 2021-05-09 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.52.1 LLVM version: 12.0.0 ``` This error also occurs on nightly, that last version that it worked on was 1.51. It seems that this only occurs if the crate-type is lib. Even if I remove a `pub`, it can compile successfully. ### Error output ``` Compiling ice_test v0.1.0 (C:\Users\David\Documents\GitHub\ice_test) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler\rustc_mir\src\monomorphize\collector.rs:746:93 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff97f0681fe - ::fmt::hbc74f7e0bfeacc3c 1: 0x7ff97f0932fc - core::fmt::write::h21444a3971da01ea 2: 0x7ff97f05be68 - ::fmt::h826464ad0b49271e 3: 0x7ff97f06c39d - std::panicking::take_hook::h3044e321765c5bc0 4: 0x7ff97f06be69 -
